questions.question: You will not be able to join the course ……………………… you make the payment in advance.
We have lived in this town …………………………….. ten years.
He was accused ………………………… stealing the money.
I ………………………….. the exam yesterday.
questions.description: Use the simple past when we say when something happened.

questions.question: She …………………….. in
questions.description: Use the simple past when we say when something happened.

questions.question: The teacher along with the students ………………………….. gone on a field trip.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with along with, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: When ……………………………… your work yesterday?
questions.description: In questions we use the inverted word order - that means the auxiliary goes before the subject.

questions.question: He ……………………………… for more than a week.
One of the students ……………………………….. not submitted their work.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after one of.

questions.question: I ……………………………… for you since 9 o’clock in the morning.
questions.description: To talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present, use the present perfect continuous tense.

questions.question: I will talk to him when he …………………………….
questions.description: When both clauses refer to the future, use the simple present in the subordinate clause.
